doc.description: Display the full documentation of this CLI

info.description: Show information about this version of 'nim'

limits.name: limits
limits.description: List the applicable Nimbella system limits

apihost.name: apihost
apihost.description: API host to query for runtimes and limits (ignored otherwise)

param.name: param
param.description: parameter values in KEY VALUE format

env.name: env
env.description: environment values in KEY VALUE format

web.name: web
web.description: treat ACTION as a web action or as a raw HTTP web action

web-secure.name: web-secure
web-secure.description: secure the web action (valid values are true, false, or any string)

param-file.name: param-file
param-file.description: FILE containing parameter values in JSON format

env-file.name: env-file
env-file.description: FILE containing environment variables in JSON format

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.description: Timeout LIMIT in milliseconds after which the Action is terminated

memory.name: memory
memory.description: Maximum memory LIMIT in MB for the Action

logsize.name: logsize
logsize.description: Maximum log size LIMIT in KB for the Action

kind.name: kind
kind.description: the KIND of the action runtime (example: swift:default, nodejs:default)

annotation.name: annotation
annotation.description: annotation values in KEY VALUE format

annotation-file.name: annotation-file
annotation-file.description: FILE containing annotation values in JSON format

sequence.name: sequence
sequence.description: treat ACTION as comma separated sequence of actions to invoke

docker.name: docker
docker.description: use provided Docker image (a path on DockerHub) to run the action

native.name: native
native.description: use default skeleton runtime where code artifact provides actual executable for the action

main.name: main
main.description: the name of the action entry point (function or fully-qualified method name when applicable)

code.name: code
code.description: show action code (only works if code is not a zip file

save.name: save
save.description: save action code to file corresponding with action name

save-as.name: save-as
save-as.description: file to save action code to

param.name: param
param.description: parameter values in KEY VALUE format

param-file.name: param-file
param-file.description: FILE containing parameter values in JSON format

no-wait.name: no-wait
no-wait.description: fire and forget (asynchronous invoke, does not wait for the result)

result.name: result
result.description: invoke action and wait for the result (default)

limit.name: limit
limit.description: only return LIMIT number of actions from the collection (default 30)

skip.name: skip
skip.description: exclude the first SKIP number of actions from the result

count.name: count
count.description: show only the total number of actions

annotation-file.description: FILE containing annotation values in JSON format

sequence.name: sequence
sequence.description: treat ACTION as comma separated sequence of actions to invoke

docker.name: docker
docker.description: use provided Docker image (a path on DockerHub) to run the action

native.name: native
native.description: use default skeleton runtime where code artifact provides actual executable for the action

main.name: main
main.description: the name of the action entry point (function or fully-qualified method name when applicable)

logs.name: logs
logs.description: emit only the logs, stripped of time stamps and stream identifier

filter.name: filter
filter.description: the name of the activations to filter on (this flag may only be used with --last)

limit.name: limit
limit.description: only return LIMIT number of activations from the collection with a maximum LIMIT of 200 activations (default 30)

skip.name: skip
skip.description: exclude the first SKIP number of activations from the result

since.name: since
since.description: return activations with timestamps later than SINCE; measured in milliseconds since Th, 01, Jan 1970

upto.name: upto
upto.description: return activations with timestamps earlier than UPTO; measured in milliseconds since Th, 01, Jan 1970

count.name: count
count.description: show only the total number of activations

activation:logs.description: Retrieves the Logs for an Activation

last.name: last
last.description: retrieves the most recent activation logs

strip.name: strip
strip.description: strip timestamp information and output first line only

count.name: count
count.description: used with --last, return the last `count` activation logs (up to 200)

filter.name: filter
filter.description: the name of the activations to filter on (this flag may only be used with --last)

activation:result.description: Retrieves the Results for an Activation

last.name: last
last.description: retrieves the most recent activation result

count.name: count
count.description: used with --last, return the last `count` activation logs (up to 200)

filter.name: filter
filter.description: the name of the activations to filter on (this flag may only be used with --last)

auth:current.description: Get current namespace with optional details

auth:export.description: Make a token for switching to another machine or web browser

non-expiring.name: non-expiring
non-expiring.description: Generate non-expiring token (for functional ids and integrations)

json.name: json
json.description: Get response as a JSON object with a "token:" member

args.name: namespace
args.description: The namespace to export (omit for current namespace)

add.name: add
add.description: Add a second or subsequent GitHub account interactively

delete.name: delete
delete.description: Forget a previously added GitHub account

initial.name: initial
initial.description: Add an initial GitHub account interactively

show.name: show
show.description: Show the access token currently associated with a username

switch.name: switch
switch.description: Switch to using a particular previously added GitHub account

token.name: token
token.description: The GitHub token when adding an account manually

username.name: username
username.description: The GitHub username when adding an account manually

auth:login.description: Gain access to a Nimbella namespace

apihost.name: apihost
apihost.description: API host to use for authentication

auth.name: auth
auth.description: API key to use for authentication

args.name: token
args.description: String provided by Nimbella Corp

all.name: all
all.description: log out of all namespaces (or, all on the given API host)

args.name: namespace
args.description: The namespace(s) you are dropping

auth:switch.description: Switch to a different Nimbella namespace

apihost.name: apihost
apihost.description: API host serving the target namespace

args.name: namespace
args.description: The namespace you are switching to

key-value:clean.description: Clears the Key Value Store, be cautious!

force.name: force
force.description: Just do it, omitting confirmatory prompt

key-value:del.description: Removes the specified keys and returns number of keys that were removed. A key is ignored if it does not exist

args.name: key
args.description: The key to be deleted

key-value:expire.description: Sets the specified ttl value for the specified key

args.name: key
args.description: The key to be added at

args.name: ttl
args.description: The ttl value to be set

apihost.name: apihost
apihost.description: API host of the namespace to list keys from

args.name: key
args.description: The key for which value is to be retrieved

apihost.name: apihost
apihost.description: API host of the namespace to list keys from

args.name: keyPrefix
args.description: The key for which value is to be retrieved

args.name: startIndex
args.description: The index to start at

args.name: count
args.description: The count to run to from start

key-value:list.description: Lists Keys from Key Value Store

apihost.name: apihost
apihost.description: API host of the namespace to list keys from

namespace.name: namespace
namespace.description: The namespace to list keys from (current namespace if omitted)

args.name: prefix
args.description: Prefix to match keys against

key-value:llen.description: Returns the length of the list stored at key. If a key does not exist, it is interpreted as an empty list and 0 is returned. An error is returned when the value stored at key is not a list.

args.name: key
args.description: The key to be queried for length

key-value:lrange.description: Returns the specified elements of the list stored at key. The offsets start and stop are zero-based indexes, with 0 being the first element of the list, 1 being the next element and so on.

apihost.name: apihost
apihost.description: API host of the namespace to list keys from

args.name: key
args.description: The key to be queried

args.name: start
args.description: The index to start

args.name: stop
args.description: The index to stop

key-value:rpush.description: Insert all the specified values at the tail of the list stored at key. It is created as an empty list before performing the push operation if the key does not exist. An error is returned when key holds such a value that is not a list

args.name: key
args.description: The key to be added at

args.name: value
args.description: The value to be added

key-value:set.description: Sets the specified value at the specified key

args.name: key
args.description: The key to be added at

args.name: value
args.description: The value to be added

apihost.name: apihost
apihost.description: API host of the namespace to list keys from

args.name: keyPrefix
args.description: The key to be set at

args.name: valuePrefix
args.description: The value to be set

args.name: startIndex
args.description: The index to start at

args.name: count
args.description: The count to run to from start

key-value:ttl.description: Get ttl value for a Key

apihost.name: apihost
apihost.description: API host of the namespace to list keys from

args.name: key
args.description: The key for which ttl value is to be retrieved

justwhisk.name: justwhisk
justwhisk.description: Remove only OpenWhisk entities, leaving other content

force.name: force
force.description: Just do it, omitting confirmatory prompt

apihost.description: The API host of the namespace to be cleaned

auth.name: auth
auth.description: The API key for the namespace to be cleaned

args.description: The namespace to clean (current namespace if omitted)

namespace:free.description: Remove project ownership restrictions from namespaces

all.name: all
all.description: free all namespaces (or, all on the given API host)

namespace:get.description: Get triggers, actions, and rules in the registry for namespace

apihost.description: API host of the namespace to get object URL from

ttl.description: Expiration time of the URL (in Minutes)

args.description: The namespace to get object from (current namespace if omitted)
